title: Bank chest

properties.name: description
properties.value: A bank chest is an interactive scenery item that allows quick access to a player's bank account, usually found in remote locations or places where a normal bank would not fit. Like any other banking facility it is indicated with a bank icon ().

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Bank chest
This article is about the common bank chest. For the bank chest on the small island on Fossil Island, see Bank Chest-wreck.

A bank chest is an interactive scenery item that allows quick access to a player's bank account, usually found in remote locations or places where a normal bank would not fit. Like any other banking facility it is indicated with a bank icon ().

Players can access their bank and their Grand Exchange collection boxes at bank-chests, but must visit a Banker to change their PIN settings or Grand Exchange offer notification settings.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
25 June 2015
(update)

Platinum Tokens - stackable, tradeable items worth 1,000 coins each - were added. Players can use any bank booth, bank chest, or banker to convert one to the other.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • There once was a banking chest on Dragontooth Island, but Jagex removed this, because a "non-removable bug" was in the bank chest, this bug meant that players would lose anything they put in the bank chest the next day.
  • The bank chest in the Barbarian Outpost and Port Khazard were previously bank deposit boxes and have since been changed into bank chests.
  • These chests used to be very popular for training skills at a bank, because they can be opened with a left-click. This advantage was applied to bank booths on 21 March 2013, making banks and chests equally advantageous.
  • Unlike all other bank chests, the chest at Wintertodt has a "Bank" option instead of a "Use" option.

Players can use any bank booth, bank chest, or banker to convert one to the other. }} {{Subject changes footer}} ==Trivia== *There once was a [[bank]]ing chest on [[Dragontooth Island]], but [[Jagex]] removed this, because a "non-removable bug" was in the bank chest, this bug meant that players would lose anything they put in the bank chest the next day. *The bank chest in the [[Barbarian Outpost]] and [[Port Khazard]] were previously [[bank deposit box]]es and have since been changed into bank chests. *These chests used to be very popular for training skills at a bank, because they can be opened with a left-click. This advantage was applied to bank booths on [[Update:Patch Notes (21 March 2013)|21 March 2013]], making banks and chests equally advantageous. [[Category:Bank]] *Unlike all other bank chests, the chest at [[Wintertodt]] has a "Bank" option instead of a "Use" option.
